revised_title: Anatomical Study of Marsipobranch Fishes: The Myxinoids
tldr: The author examines the skeletal structure of myxinoids, a type of marsipobranch fish, and compares it to the lamprey and other related species. They describe the unique cartilage development and cranio-facial features of myxinoids, which provide insights into the evolution of vertebrates. The study highlights the importance of these lowly evolved fish in understanding the morphology and development of the vertebrate skeleton.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Vertebrate anatomy
